1     Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

      The City of Florence Water Department as operators of the Wilson Lake Water Treatment Plant are 
      committed to employee, public and enviromental saftey. This commitiment is demostrated by our accidental
      prevention program that covers such areas as design,installation, operating procedures, maintenance and
      training. It is our policy to implement apporiate controls to prevent possible releases of regulated substances.
      It is also our policy provide training to all our employees that handle any regulated substance. If a release
      occurs we are coordinated with the City of Florence Fire Department and the Florence Lauderdale EMA, which
      provides emergency personnel and equipment to control and mitigate the effects of a release.

2    The Facility and The Regulated Substance Handled

     The Wilson Lake Water Treatment Plant primary activities is to provide potable water to the City of Florence
     and Lauderdale County and to meet or exceed all Federal and State regulations. We have one regulated 
     substance at this facility. This substance is Chlorine. The Chlorine used at this facility is used for disinfecting
     treated water for potable use by the City of Florence and Lauderdale County.

     The maximum inventory at this facility is 12,000 pounds.

3    The General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps

     his facility has taken all the necessary steps to comply with the accidental release prevention requriments set
     out under 40 CFR part 68 of the EPA. The following sections breifly describe the elements of the release 
     prevention program that is in place at our facility.

     Process Saftey Information

     The Wilson Lake Water Treatment Plant maintains saftey information that describes the hazards of Chlorine,
     operating parameters and procedures and equipment designs associated with the Chlori

nating process.

     Process Hazard Review

     This facility conducts reviews regularly of the chlorination system to ensure the hazards assoicated with our
     process are identified and controlled. The reviews are done by the plant superintendent, lead maintenance 
     and operator personnel.

     Training

     This facility has a training program in place to ensure that all personnel are trained in the hazards and safe
     handleing of Chlorine. This program requires that each employee that handles Chlorine to take a refresher
     training every three years. All of our employees are grade IV certified operators in the State of Alabama.

     Maintenance

     This facilities maintenance personnel preform maintenance checks on all process equipment to ensure proper
     operations. The equipment checks include storage tanks, pipeing and valve systems, relife and vent systems
     emergency shut down systems and controls.If any deficiencies are found they are corrected in a safe and 
     timely manner. All maintenance personnel are offered specislized training as needed.

     Employee Participation

     All employees at this facility are encouraged to express their views on accidental release prevention and to 
     recommend improvements.

4    The Five Year Accident History

      This facility has an excllent record of preventing any accidental release over the last 5 years. There has been 
      no releases from this facility during the period.

5     The Emergency Program

      This facility has coordinated with the City of Florence Fire Department and the Florence Lauderdale EMA to 
      respond with emergency personnel and equipment as needed in an accidental release. All facility personnel
      are required to update their training every three years, and specialized training is done as needed. We have
      not done any drills up to this point. This facility has a public notification system in place to notify the public
      in the event of

a accidental release.

6    Planned Changes to Improve Saftey

     There are some changes this facility needs to make to improve saftey. Plans are currently being made to have
     a drill with the City of Florence Fire Department and Florence Lauderdale EMA on our emergency response. We
     at the City of Florence Water Department are committed to saftey and are always seeking to improve saftey.
